title: Nationals Park unleashes 'Baby Shark' at World Series
text:
“Baby Shark” was finally played in the World Series.

Nationals outfielder Gerardo Parra got to pinch-hit for catcher Kurt Suzuki Friday in Game 3 — giving the sold-out Nationals Park crowd a chance to clap in unison to the popular tune.

Parra uses the children’s song as his walk-up music and it has become an anthem for the Nationals this season.

Watch the crowd of 43,867 react below:

Here’s what the first World Series “Baby Shark” at Nationals Park looks like pic.twitter.com/XuS1eaJMgE — Matthew Paras (@Matthew_Paras) October 26, 2019

Despite the reaction, Parra struck out and the Nationals trail 4-1.

description: Nationals outfielder Gerardo Parra got to pinch-hit for catcher Kurt Suzuki Friday in Game 3 -- giving the sold-out Nationals Park crowd a chance to clap in unison to the popular tune.
